title: Where can first-time buyers can get on the ladder without paying stamp duty?
text:
When you’ve spent years saving to buy your first home, having to part with thousands more to cover the cost of stamp duty can feel like a kick in the teeth.

Since 2017, many first-time buyers have been able to sidestep paying the tax. Anyone buying a first home for less than £300,000 is exempt, while those purchasing a property worth up to £500,000 will only pay stamp duty – at a rate of 5 per cent – on the amount above £300,000.
